NATIONAL ASSOCIATION
OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
OFFICE OF THE REGIONAL DIRECTOR
Radio Stations KFKU-KANU
The University of Kansas
Lawrence, Kansas
June 15, 1962
Mr. R. B. Hull, Chr., NAEB Board
Mr. R. D. Hurlbert, Chr. , TV Board
Mr. W. G. Harley, Pres.
Dear Dick, Ray, and Bill:
Not being the manager of a TV station I did not receive
whatever inspired your memo of June 12 to the ETV managers
but I want to commend you for your reply, and especially
to say ’’Amen" to your comment that radio directors Miles,
Browne, Press and Paulu are all heavily involved in ETV
activities.
Even if this were not so, it is in the nature of organi¬
zational procedure that the Board of Directors should possess
the authority to act in executive capacity for the body else
why have a board.’ It seems to have become fashionable to
call ’’cavalier" or "capricious" any decision that runs counter
to the wish of a vocal minority.
1/
The matter in question was discussed thoroughly. All
parties in interest had full opportunity to speak. The final
vote with only two dissents speaks for itself, jj
Si
R. Edwin Browne
Secretary
